title: ELO Ratings Example
text: original ELO models chess use values 0 loss, 1 win 0.5 draw. Since adapting AFL want use margin rather binary outcome, need map margin score 0 1. can many varied complex ways, now, just normalise everything based margin -80 80. Anything outside goes margins 0 1. create function use function elo model.
code: map_margin_to_outcome <- function(margin, marg.max = 80, marg.min = -80) {   norm <- (margin - marg.min) / (marg.max - marg.min)   norm %>%     pmin(1) %>%     pmax(0) }

title: Introduction to fitzRoy

title: Introduction to fitzRoy
text: ladder particular round can returned using fetch_ladder. Usually makes sense return one round time, although possible return multiple rounds. many variables included AFL.com.au ladder. can get ladder data sources including Squiggle Afltables. default source fetch_ladder() AFL.com.au website.
code: ladder <- fetch_ladder(2020, round_number = 7, comp = "AFLW") %>%   select(     season, round_name, position,     team.name, pointsFor, pointsAgainst, form   ) ladder #> # A tibble: 14 × 7 #>    season round_name  position team.name         pointsFor pointsAgainst form   #>     <dbl> <chr>          <int> <chr>                 <int>         <int> <chr>  #>  1   2020 Semi Finals        1 Kangaroos               309           136 LWWWWW #>  2   2020 Semi Finals        2 GWS Giants              175           142 WLWLWW #>  3   2020 Semi Finals        3 Brisbane Lions          198           185 WWDWLL #>  4   2020 Semi Finals        4 Gold Coast Suns         154           152 LWDLLW #>  5   2020 Semi Finals        5 Geelong Cats            211           261 LLLWWL #>  6   2020 Semi Finals        6 Adelaide Crows          180           224 LWWLLL #>  7   2020 Semi Finals        7 Richmond                115           322 LLLLLL #>  8   2020 Semi Finals        1 Fremantle               277           179 WWWWWW #>  9   2020 Semi Finals        2 Carlton                 249           164 WLWWWW #> 10   2020 Semi Finals        3 Melbourne               204           124 WWLWWL #> 11   2020 Semi Finals        4 Collingwood             229           149 WWLLWW #> 12   2020 Semi Finals        5 St Kilda                154           170 LLWLLW #> 13   2020 Semi Finals        6 Western Bulldogs        179           246 WLLLLL #> 14   2020 Semi Finals        7 West Coast Eagles        85           265 LLLWLL ladder <- fetch_ladder(2020, round_number = 7, comp = "AFLW") ncol(ladder) #> [1] 86 ladder_afl <- fetch_ladder(2020, round_number = 11) ladder_aflw <- fetch_ladder(2020, comp = "AFLW") ladder_squiggle <- fetch_ladder_squiggle(2019, round_number = 1) ladder_afltables <- fetch_ladder_afltables(1990)

title: Introduction to fitzRoy
text: can view return data two providers using API’s respective Vignettes. Using Squiggle API Using Fryzigg API

title: Main Fetch functions
text: number main functions fetch_fixture - returns fixture given round season fetch_lineup - returns lineup matches given round season fetch_results - returns match results given round season fetch_ladder - returns ladder given round season fetch_player_stats - returns detailed player stats set matches within given round season fetch_player_details - returns details players date birth, height, weight debut (depending source)

title: Main Fetch functions
text: function generally accepts 4 arguments. consistent functions provide sane common defaults. common arguments : season - season seasons return data . NULL (default), return season matches Sys.Date() round_number- round return data . NULL (default), return data rounds source - source return data . Must one “AFL” (default), “footywire”, “fryzigg”, “afltables”, “squiggle” comp - competition return data . Must one “AFLM” (default), “AFLW”, “VFL”, “VFLW”, “WAFL”, “U18B” “U18G.” data sources non-AFL data.

title: Main Fetch functions

title: Main Fetch functions
text: new functions now access consistent AFLW data first time! high level, fetch_ function allow specify comp = "AFLW return data. Please note Womens data exists source = "AFL", default fetch_ functions. Read full AFL Womens Vingette specific examples.

title: Main Fetch functions
text: experimental feature version 1.2.0 returning non-AFL related data. works source AFL comps available. comps much data AFLM AFLW comps functions work. Available comps include * “VFL” * “VFLW” * “WAFL” * “U18B” * “U18G”
code: fetch_fixture(2022, source = "AFL", comp = "VFL") fetch_player_stats(2022, round = 1, source = "AFL", comp = "VFLW") fetch_fixture(2022, source = "AFL", comp = "WAFL")

title: Fetching Player Details
text: can use fetch_player_details return list player details given club source. source determine exactly details returned. default AFL.com.au website. AFL website return AFLW AFLM data, sources include AFLM data. list details returned AFL.com.au website . AFLTables.com source return players played specified team time. Footywire.com source allows specify just current list players, fairly quick, players time can little slow. One challenge source accepts different values team argument. helper function return error wrong team supplied provide list acceptable values specific source.
code: fetch_player_details("Hawthorn") details_aflw <- fetch_player_details(team = "Western Bulldogs", current = TRUE, comp = "AFLW", source = "AFL")  head(details_aflw) glimpse(details_aflw) fetch_player_details("Hawthorn", source = "afltables") fetch_player_details("Richmond", source = "footywire", current = TRUE) fetch_player_details("Greater Western Sydney", source = "afltables")

title: Using Fryzigg API
text: included function interface Fryzigg API. data set includes advanced AFL stats typically available existing open data sites footywire.com afltables.com. Many thanks Fryzigg providing API interface.

title: Using Fryzigg API
text: primary way access data via fetch_fryzigg_stats() function. function provides easy interface Fryzigg API. takes one arguments - season can single year multiple years. can get quick view fields returned fryzigg API. can see data includes player team data, row game player.

text: can access data Squiggle API directly fetch_squiggle_data. allows direct access Squiggle API. Note also provide helper functions map closely fetch_ functions fetch_ladder_squiggle.

title: Using the Squiggle API
text: Full instructions constructing queries can found Squiggle API. One following must provided query argument. teams - Info teams (e.g. Richmond, Geelong, West Coast) games - Info games (e.g. Round 1, 2019 Richmond v Carlton) sources - Info models (e.g. Matter Stats, GRAFT, Swinburne) tips - Info tips predictions made models standings - Info team standings (.e. ladder) ladder - Info predicted ladders generated models virtual - Info Virtually Season 2020 pav - Info Player Approximate Value HPN Footy

title: Using the Squiggle API
text: Optional arguments can supplied based query. example, games takes following optional arguments. * year - Year * round - Round * game - Game ID * complete - Percent game complete can supplied named arguments query. example, return games just 2020, use following.
code: fetch_squiggle_data(query = "games", year = 2020) #> # A tibble: 162 × 24 #>    ascore hteamid hgoals localtime    is_grand_final date  hscore ateamid agoals #>     <int>   <int>  <int> <chr>                 <int> <chr>  <int>   <int>  <int> #>  1     74       1     11 2020-03-21 …              0 2020…     71      16     11 #>  2     57       5      9 2020-03-21 …              0 2020…     63       6      8 #>  3     76       8      4 2020-03-21 …              0 2020…     29      13     10 #>  4     73       9     17 2020-03-21 …              0 2020…    105       7     11 #>  5     62      10     14 2020-03-22 …              0 2020…     90       2      9 #>  6     54      12      8 2020-03-22 …              0 2020…     56      15      7 #>  7     81      14     16 2020-03-19 …              0 2020…    105       3     12 #>  8     51      17     12 2020-03-22 …              0 2020…     78      11      7 #>  9     86      18      5 2020-03-20 …              0 2020…     34       4     13 #> 10     69       2     12 2020-06-13 …              0 2020…     81       6     10 #> # ℹ 152 more rows #> # ℹ 15 more variables: hbehinds <int>, venue <chr>, hteam <chr>, #> #   is_final <int>, id <int>, roundname <chr>, round <int>, winner <chr>, #> #   abehinds <int>, ateam <chr>, tz <chr>, updated <chr>, complete <int>, #> #   winnerteamid <int>, year <int>

title: AFL Womens Example
text: get_aflw_detailed_data() can used return detailed data match data shown . takes vector match IDs argument. example, let’s say want detailed stats first 10 games match_data . :
code: first10 <- head(match_data, 10) first10_ids <- first10$Match.Id first10_ids #> NULL detailed <- get_aflw_detailed_data(first10_ids) glimpse(detailed) #> Rows: 0 #> Columns: 0

title: Calculate Coaches Vote Possibilities — calculate_coaches_vote_possibilities
text: calculate_coaches_vote_possibilities returns possible breakdowns coaches votes two coaches, given breakdown AFLCA coaches votes

title: Calculate Coaches Vote Possibilities — calculate_coaches_vote_possibilities
text: df Requires following column names: Player.Name, Coaches.Votes. can returned function fetch_coaches_votes. output_type One "Coach View", "Player View". Defaults "Coach View".

title: Calculate Coaches Vote Possibilities — calculate_coaches_vote_possibilities
text: Data frame output_type "Coach View" - list data frames columns: Votes, C1, C2 output_type "Player View" - list data frames columns: Player, V1, V2

title: Calculate Coaches Vote Possibilities — calculate_coaches_vote_possibilities
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Return coaches votes for a particular match, then find the possibilities df <- fetch_coaches_votes(comp = "AFLM", season = 2021, round = 24, team = "Western Bulldogs") calculate_coaches_vote_possibilities(df, "Coach View")  df <- fetch_coaches_votes(comp = "AFLW", season = 2021, round = 9, team = "Western Bulldogs") calculate_coaches_vote_possibilities(df, "Player View")  # Create a manual data frame to calculate possibilities df <- data.frame(   Player.Name = c(     "Tom Liberatore", "Jack Macrae",     "Marcus Bontempelli", "Cody Weightman",     "Darcy Parish", "Aaron Naughton", "Jordan Ridley"   ),   Coaches.Votes = c(7, 6, 5, 5, 4, 2, 1) ) calculate_coaches_vote_possibilities(df, "Player View") } # }

what: Return the fixture for a particular round of matches — fetch_fixture
title: Return the fixture for a particular round of matches — fetch_fixture
text: fetch_fixture returns Fixture given AFL Round. Internally, calls corresponding fetch_fixture_* function depends source given. default source used official AFL website. fetch_fixture_afl(), fetch_fixture_footywire(), fetch_fixture_squiggle() can called directly return data AFL website, AFL Tables Squiggle, respectively.

title: Return the fixture for a particular round of matches — fetch_fixture
code: fetch_fixture(   season = NULL,   round_number = NULL,   comp = "AFLM",   source = "AFL",   ... )  fetch_fixture_afl(season = NULL, round_number = NULL, comp = "AFLM")  fetch_fixture_footywire(   season = NULL,   round_number = NULL,   convert_date = FALSE )  fetch_fixture_squiggle(season = NULL, round_number = NULL)

title: Return the fixture for a particular round of matches — fetch_fixture
text: season Season YYYY format, defaults NULL returns year corresponding Sys.Date() round_number Round number, defaults NULL returns latest round comp One "AFLM" (default), "AFLW", "VFL", "VFLW", "WAFL", "U18B" "U18G." data sources non-AFL data source One "AFL" (default), "footywire", "fryzigg", "afltables", "squiggle" ... Optional parameters passed onto various functions depending source. convert_date logical, TRUE, converts date column date format instead date time.

title: Fetch Player Details — fetch_player_details

title: Fetch Player Stats — fetch_player_stats
text: season Season YYYY format, defaults NULL returns year corresponding Sys.Date() round_number Round number, defaults NULL returns latest round comp One "AFLM" (default), "AFLW", "VFL", "VFLW", "WAFL", "U18B" "U18G." data sources non-AFL data source One "AFL" (default), "footywire", "fryzigg", "afltables", "squiggle" ... Optional parameters passed onto various functions depending source. rescrape Logical, defaults FALSE. Determines re-scrape data given season. default, return cached data much faster. Re-scraping slow sometimes needed historical data changed. rescrape_start_season Numeric, rescrape = TRUE, season start scraping . Defaults minimum value season check_existing logical, check existing data. likely removed future version takes long time re-scrape data

title: fitzRoy: Easily Scrape and Process AFL Data — fitzRoy-package
text: easy package scraping processing Australia Rules Football (AFL) data. 'fitzRoy' provides range functions accessing publicly available data 'AFL Tables' https://afltables.com/afl/afl_index.html, 'Footy Wire' https://www.footywire.com 'Squiggle' https://squiggle.com.au. functions allow easy processing, cleaning transformation data formats can used analysis.
